alert.note: Alert for Crow Wing; South Aitkin; South Cass (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 20 at 11:19AM CST until December 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...South Cass, Crow Wing and South Aitkin Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Mille Lacs Band, East Lake area. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A new Wind Chill Advisory will likely be needed tonight as wind chills drop as low as 35 below zero. Snow loading on trees from the past storm in combination with the high winds may cause heavy tree damage resulting in widespread power outages in cold weather. Blizzard conditions are possible.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Crow Wing; South Aitkin; South Cass
